reviews.text: Mismanaged and shady.<br>I came in at about 5:15 pm on 8/8. The website indicated that reservations were not available, but that this was because the majority of the restaurant have been reserved for walkins. When I arrived, there were 15 to 20 tables on the patio, and only two were taken. I went in and the restaurant was at under half capacity. The hostess said: &#34;I have about an hour and a half wait.&#34; I asked: &#34;even for patio.&#34; And she said: &#34;oh yes, that&#39;s a TWO hour wait!&#34; She indicated that all tables were reserved. Either the website was lying or the staff was. Either way, the process was horribly mismanaged and suspicious.

Been to this place twice recently, and both times the food is consistently solid. The first time I was there was for my friend&#39;s birthday dinner. I was mopey and needed something soothing so I got the chicken and dumplings. The dumplings are tender and took on the flavors of the chicken broth that they were cooked in. The white chicken meat was flavorful and tender as well. The meal really hit the spot and made me feel better. Wished I was in better spirits for her birthday though.<br><br>The second time I came was for breakfast after church with my friends. I was trying to watch what I was eating, but all hell broke loose when I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes. I wanted to lick the plate because it was good, but I refrained myself and only ate half of my order.<br><br>The place is constantly busy and in a location very close to my church so it&#39;s convenient to go  there. I&#39;ve yet to try any of their cheesecakes actually. I know, who goes to a place called Cheesecake Factory without trying their signature dishes? This girl.<br><br>Even though it&#39;s a chain restaurant, I like it. Food is usually large portions as well so you won&#39;t leave hungry.
Food was good and we had the best server. Our drinks were kept full. Cheesecake for dessert is always great.

Cheesecake Factory is notoriously delicious! However, their curbside pick-up is unsatisfactory. We did not receive the food we paid for and the wait is longer than the time given. <br><br>This was the first restaurant we chose for a great celebration experience. So, it was with great anticipation that we chose this restaurant as our first quarantine take-out in honor of our son&#39; 16th birthday! We ordered food for six people. <br>When  my husband went to pick-up the order, we were told to wait for hot bread. Our initial wait time was 25 minutes. When he arrived, we were told to &#34;wait&#34; another ten minutes for &#34;hot&#34; bread.<br><br>They eventually brought the food to our curbside pick-up. My husband asked if everything was included. They said, &#34;Yes!&#34;  We drove the ten minute drive back home to eat. <br><br>We were ready to dine and celebrate! <br>We came home and checked the orders. Much to our dismay, they were not fulfilled. With all the four orders that included fries, none of the fries were not sent with the meals. It was disappointing because were waited with anticipation for this meal the entire day. <br>In fact, we were truly shocked and disappointed! As with any business, when a patron orders the food and pays for it, it is the restaurant responsibility to serve   them what was paid for. <br><br>I called the restaurant. They offered for us to return to get the fries or send a $20 &#34; gift card&#34; in seven to ten business days. Because we could not afford to waste 30 minutes to get fries, we opted for the gift card. However, what we really needed was full service at the time of the order. <br>I hope that Cheesecake Factory can double check their curbside orders in the future.<br>I would not recommend ordering curbside from this restaurant.

LET&#39;S EAT CAKE....cheesecake for this review. <br><br>I came to this casually nice, American restaurant chain since they offer gluten-free food for people that has a gluten allergy such as my mom. You&#39;d expect that she&#39;d get cross- containment food and get sick since she&#39;s extremely sensitive but Cheesecake Factory did an amazing job of no cross-contamination.<br><br>I came with a group of 12 and it took a while for the restaurant get us seated even though it was just at the beginning/30min prior to the Saturday night dinner rush. The staff was very patient and hospitable when we were at the table and did a pretty good job to this crowd happy. Prior to us getting our food we were given bread and butter to keep us content for the to be served and staff kept us stocked during the wait.<br><br>I don&#39;t think anyone at the table had anything negative to say about the food which is great since I was with a crowd that could get picky. We ordered several cheesecakes to bring home and eat later. I was surprised that they had a gluten free cheesecake that was a flourless Chocolate godiva cheesecake that my gobbled down and once again she didn&#39;t get sick. <br><br>I came back a few weeks later to pick up several slices of cheesecake for my sister and her swedish friend who was visiting.

Using yelp to make a dinner reservation was fantastic and we highly recommend utilizing this feature. The hostess was friendly  and was quick to let us know we wouldn&#39;t be waiting long at all which was nice because we showed up about 15-20 minutes early and it was a packed reception area. Our server Bryan was first-rate and he  did a phenomenal job of making recommendations, paying attention to the water glasses, and everything else that goes into a great dining experience. We started off with cocktails, pineapple Moscow mule  and a pineapple mojito; both were tasty and had the perfect amount of alcohol. We enjoyed the bread and Brussel sprouts to start but the maple glaze wasn&#39;t present, at least not taste wise.  I ordered the pork schnitzel and my wife ordered the chicken parm pizza style. The pork schnitzel was to-die-for and the chicken parm was good but not great.  We finished off the meal with cheesecake to-go. We ordered the dolce de leche and the turtle cheesecake, we definitely love the Dolce De Leche.

Five stars for the bang bang chicken and shrimp. How have I not had this sooner? Who cares about cheesecake after a dish like this!! So delicious!<br><br>Service was decent, our waitress was a little on the quiet and slow side. I thought she went shopping with my card when I sent it with the bill because she didn&#39;t return in what seemed like an eternity.<br><br>Already planning my next visit for the end dish!

I have a high regard for fairness and communication. With those values in mind, I am giving The Cheesecake Factory one star. <br><br>On 4/3 I ordered a Cobb salad and a Sheila&#39;s Chicken &amp; Avocado salad to take advantage of a Door Dash promotion. I tipped the driver at full value.  The total for the two salads was $35.48. I am willing to pay higher prices for places like The Cheesecake Factory because I usually get a couple meals out of one entrée. <br><br>Both salads had plenty of lettuce but not much else.  In my &#34;Sheila&#39;s&#34; salad, I MIGHT have had 2 ounces of chicken, but it was doubtful. Very little avocado. Same situation with the Cobb. <br><br>I believe in giving businesses the opportunity to make things right so on 4/3 I went to the restaurant around 5:20 pm and asked to speak with the manager. I explained what happened. He said he was surprised this happened as they have the same standards for to-go orders as they do dine in orders.  I told him I understood that training issues exist but knew they couldn&#39;t be corrected unless management was aware of them. He indicated usually &#34;these types&#34; of situations &#34;go thru Door Dash&#34; but that since I had come in, he would take care of making it right. (Did he think the driver ate the ingredients from our salads??) I thanked him as paying $35.48 for two lame salads really didn&#39;t sit well with me.  He asked for my name and address and told me he would ask TCF headquarters in CA to send something to me. He thought I&#39;d get it the next week. <br><br>Two weeks later I have yet to receive anything.  I gave The Cheesecake Factory the opportunity to recover from a poor service experience. In return, I got an even worse one.

The worst service ever!  Should have ordered from the Bristol.  Ordered food at 5pm for 7pm pick up.  An hour later still no food!  Another guy waited 2 and 1/2 hours and still no food!  They kept saying, &#34;it&#39;s on the way&#34; then &#34;we are bagging it&#34;.  Then they came back and said it&#39;s not ready and we can not tell you how long it will take.  We said then just cancel our order and refund our card.  They then said it would take 4 weeks for a refund.  An hour and 15 minutes later and we finally just left with NO FOOD and no refund.  Now we have to call tomorrow to make sure we get a refund.  And let&#39;s face it, the foods not that great anyways.

The staff here was amazing! Loved our waitress, she was fantastic! There is lots of options on the menu to choose from, and of course the cheesecake is just perfect. Loved the cocktail menu and the variety of the other drink specials. I got the pulled pork sliders, and they were just savory little morsels! I loved the Smokey sweetness or the pulled pork mixed with the slaw, and fried pickles! The buns were soft and buttery and paired well with  the meat/toppings without getting soggy. The piña mojitos were great, and the Oreo extreme cheesecake was rich, but a chocolate delight!
The service was slow and it took 1:30 minutes for food to come out. They also forgot my drink for 30 minutes. Overall very slow

I was surprised to have to wait on a Monday night, but it was definitely worth it. Kirsten was sweet and attentive as our waitress, despite how busy they were. <br><br>It was delicious as always. I veered away from my normal pasta order and tried the Shepherds Pie. I was struggling between the two, but I was very glad our waitress convinced my to try something new- it was delicious! My husband tried the Mac and cheeseburger and I was lucky enough to steal a bite- it was absolutely heaven. There is no wrong choice here.
We&#39;ve always loved Cheesecake. Even during Covid they didn&#39;t disappoint. The same wonderful quality and of course amazing desserts.

Really disappointed with not only my initial experience but then how it was handled by management. <br><br>I placed a to go order on April 16 and it said it would be ready in 25 minutes. We headed there and called the phone number posted on the sign for curbside pickup. The line was busy for the first five minutes we waited until we finally got ahold of someone. They answered and said our orders would be right out. We then waited an additional 45 minutes before calling again to check on our order. I was told it would be right out. 10 minutes later and still nothing I called again and asked to speak to a manager and I was on hold for another 7 minutes before hanging up. Our food finally arrived and it was cold. I called to talk to a manager and was put in contact with Kevin, the general manager, who said he couldn&#39;t do anything to refund my meal, which doesn&#39;t quite seem right, but he would mail me gift cards. I gave him all of my contact info including address and he said I should receive them in 5-7 days. It&#39;s now been 14 days and not only have we not received anything, but we called yesterday and a different manager said there was no indication of our complaint ever being filed AND even if it was the gift card max would have been $50 when our meal for our family was $150. He then told me to call back another time to talk to Kevin. Really disappointed and won&#39;t be back to this location and will definitely not be recommending them. Horrible management and customer service.

We found Cheesecake Factory near our hotel.  Not sure why we go out of town and eat at places we have in STL, but this place was SOOO good we ate here 3 nights LOL.  I love the orange chicken, it&#39;s definitely my favorite.  Cashew chicken was really good.  Oh, and the chicken marsala was AMAZING!!!!  The menu is overwhelming, but every dish is executed so well.  It&#39;s really amazing the chefs are so good to be able to make all of these things and have them be so great every time.  Sadly, I generally eat too much to have cheesecake, but the few I have tried have always been fabulous.
Long wait, but we&#39;ll worth it. Super fun waiter, very helpful and my kids loved it. The food was alright, a large menu. Definitely will go back for their cheesecake.

First of all....we found a non-bar in Overland Park, that stays open til midnight?! #stillshocked #butfirst #CHEESECAKE<br><br>The hubs and I first endulged in our cheesecakes, then we got an entrée and I got an appie. It was totally still popppin&#39; off and the weather was great, so the outside seating was full too. I love seeing people out at nite. (Heart of a city girl.) <br><br>If we went to a bar, then we only would&#39;ve gotten deep fried something and, forget about dessert (a statement that would never actually come out of my mouth! Hah! Pun intended) <br><br>Needless to say, it was so great to still have kind and speedy service, despite the crowd and time of nite.

This was by far our worst visit here. Food once we got all of it was ok. However of the 5 of us ku meal did not show up until everyone else was done with there&#39;s. We were polite and did not complain. Thinking they would take it off the ticket for the inconvenience. But that did not happen. And to top it off once we gave credit card to pay. It took over 10 minutes to get my card back. Not sure why service is so bad at these prices. <br>Very disappointed

My boyfriend took me here to celebrate our 2nd anniversary. Before picking me up he stopped here with flowers and asked if they could be placed on the table. All of the staff helped him surprise me ! I was so shocked to come to a booth with rose petals and two dozen flowers waiting for me. The staff was amazing and my server Emma was such a delight ! The food was amazing and they even decorated my plate when I ordered dessert. This Cheesecake Factory passes up the plaza location 10 fold with customer service, food, quality and environment! 10/10 stars. I have absolutely no complaints - I even ordered an alcoholic beverage that was not on the menu but the bar tenders were able to make it perfectly ! Thanks again for making my second anniversary worth while !

The food here was amazing today! I had the turkey avocado club....so fresh and delicious!  Hubby had the Mac n cheese burger..great!  The pineapple upside down cheesecake was beyond great!  He had the tiramasu cheesecake and lived it too!  Would def go back again!

Been to this location many times, but first time to write a review. This Cheesecake Factory location certainly knows how to honor the company&#39;s demand for excellence and absolute guest satisfaction. I had the shrimp with Angel hair hair; the angel hair was cooked to perfection, the shrimp were scrumptious, and every spice in it was perfectly balanced for a delightful experience. I had a Skinny Mojito and honestly  it was probably the best mojito ever made, thank you Cody (bartender).  Avocado eggrolls and crab and artichoke dip was perfect as well. The service was 4 star which is great for this type of restaurant, so it still gets a 5 star. <br><br>This last Saturday I had Brunch at The ORIGINAL, Beverly Hills  location, and boy they could learn a thing or two from the Overland Park staff. Keep up the great job CF OP
Their information on the takeout process needs to be clearer. We sat waiting for a text and it was not until one of the waitress that was running food stopped by and asked if we were here to pick up.

Ordered lunch for curbside pickup today Mother&#39;s Day with a pickup time at 1pm.  It is now 2:30pm with no idea when order will be ready. If you do not have the staff to handle the orders, then you need to limit the orders you take in as you should have expected a surge in orders today. Now 3:17 and still no order. They said they can&#39;t find it after saying they were making my order a priority. I gave them the confirmation number and they now say that that number was cancelled as they were out of one item and the system canceled it out.  When I check my credit card statement real time it shows I have been charged. Now they are making my order after we had to redo it with other items they had available.
Good food &amp; great place to take picture. I love the pasta. Had great time w my friend there. The steak also good too
Hadn&#39;t been here in a while but I must say it was a good experience and the food was good. This is not my favorite spot or high on my lists but I enjoyed my meal and the atmosphere.

I finally had to contact the ceo to get any results! They sent me a gift card but that wasn&#39;t what I was after! They said they couldn&#39;t find anything wrong? I&#39;ve been a customer for 30 years and this is my first complaint so you know I wasn&#39;t making up being sick! Gave away gift card as I don&#39;t know if I&#39;ll ever go back after such poor response!
The CBD cheesecake is a delectable piece of work and I will be visiting again soon. Thank you, kindly. Xoxo

I was happy with my experience today. It was easy to make a reservation and had no issues getting in upon arrival. Everyone had masks on, the tables were socially distanced, and the menus were via QR code. I felt comfortable being there given the circumstances. We placed several orders, both to eat there and to go, and all orders were correct and brought to us quickly. The waitress was friendly and attentive. Most importantly - the food was delicious!

This service was SO rude, so UNNECESSARY, and SO TERRIBLE that I would NEVER recommend to come here again for a dine in experience. <br><br>It has taken a lot of time for me to process how TERRIBLE my service that I received on May 22nd with my colleagues. <br><br>One evening out to celebrate our business success, we decided to go to Cheesecake Factory and share a nice meal and dessert. We pre ordered a cheesecake before our meal; was told to just tell our server, then we were seated by a less than enthused manager just shoving menus into our hostesses hands and we were seated. <br><br>After 20 minutes we were finally seen by our high ATTITUDE giving waitresss who basically seemed as if we were troubling her by being seated in her area. <br><br>We asked for water with lemons, she shows up with water - no lemons and we asked for lemons, 15 minutes later we got a bowl. We never saw her to deliver our food, a table adjacent to our booth were served first before us and then we get our food. She refilled drinks once, not even everyone got a refill.<br><br>We told her that we previously ordered a cheesecake, and it was the only time she ever smiled. <br><br>She then took 25 minutes to bring us our cheesecake. Brought us small plates and the wrong kind of spatula to serve- which by the way, she didn&#39;t offer to help serve us and just left it. <br><br>Then we waited another 20 minutes for her to even take the check! We were so tired by the time she even came around, we had to go up and bring the check to the manager to cash us out. When she came to us she looked annoyed and said &#34;and where&#39;s your check?&#34;  We said we brought it up to a manager and she said &#34;oh someone else took it and dropped off our take away containers&#34;<br><br>If you want to eat here be prepared to waste a few hours for some lackluster service. <br><br>The food is good but not for the price you pay in terrible &#34;customer&#34; service!!

I&#39;ve been 2 times. <br><br>First time was for my birthday with my husband. We were sat in a 2-top in the corner and were forgotten. Server got our drink order  (from the bar) and I requested bread..... and she never came back.  We did not have water or anything for several minutes until I got the attention of another server (other servers did not acknowledge us even though their table is right next to us). Other tables by our server were given food but no plates, napkins or silverware- they had to walk to find another server as well. Eventually we ordered and got our salads at the same time as food and never got bread. Had decided we wouldn&#39;t come back..<br><br>Second visit- my friend recommended going and I agreed as the menu has variety and should please everyone. (5 of us waited an hour at the bar 7:30 Saturday, when quoted 35-45.) That&#39;s not a big deal.. we got drinks and it was Sat night....EXCEPT  Before we found our friends at the bar, we walked thru the restaurant thinking they were already seated. There were at least 15 open tables.... but the entire lobby was full and quoted an hour to seat. When we tried to check in with the hosts at ~45m they said &#34;we have campers&#34;. What they probably meant was that those guests were probably still stuck at their tables waiting for food or checks. Must have been understaffed.. we were seated in a back room corner (the room filled with completely empty tables) and given waters... then assumed to be forgotten again for at least 15-20m. Once again... we got up to find another server to find our server. He apologized and explained his other table ordered 30 cheesecakes to go. Maybe more team work is needed for servers to help each other out- just my experience when I worked with at restaurants- our managers would write servers up if not greeted within 2 min. Food came out in 15-20m and it was good/ok. Definitely do NOT order the Buffalo Blasts. They were fried wonton wrappers that were Basically EMPTY. So after eating oily fried dough and halfway thru you haven&#39;t had any bites of chicken.. kinda makes you sick from the grease. <br>Finally left at 10:15. Longest dinner ever- we were planning to be somewhere at 9:30. I want to come back to try more of the menu items... but the service isn&#39;t always great and you may have to get up to find people. (Otherwise our server was good the rest of the night).

Totally a chain, but this one is a pretty good one. My food always comes out great, the service is always good, and they&#39;re always so nice to my kids! I love that. I usually just get the orange chicken, it&#39;s so good, it&#39;s super crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, chunks of chicken! My son loves their cheeseburgers and then we all share a slice of heaven I mean cheesecake!

Will not be eating here again. Unfortunately I got food poisoning from this location. Other than me getting food poisoning, the service was really good and the food was good but contaminated. My friend and i both threw up from this food. I&#39;d hate to give this place 1 Star though since my experience was still okay.

I&#39;m not sure what&#39;s going on at this location, but the last several odd-ball times we&#39;ve tried to go here, the wait has been an hour for just 2 people.  The first time was at 3 pm (45 min) and the second was 1:30 pm on a weekday (1.5 hr).  It&#39;s fascinating that people love a chain restaurant that much, but service needs to speed up or CF needs to join the 21st century and take reservations.  I&#39;m giving 3 stars for the last dish I had here.. the chicken parm!

Their curbside delivery service is terrible.  We ordered our meal at 5:15.  We were told(probably an automatic computer system that spits out responses) that our meal would be ready at 5:45.  We arrived at 5:45, talked to an inside operator who said they would be right out with our food.  Forty five minutes later we received a text that we could either pick up our food inside or bring it out.  We texted to have it brought out, but after 10 minutes I went in to retrieve my food.  Which defeated the whole purpose of social isolation, etc.   we talked to others waiting for food and some had been there for over an hour.  So we were not an isolated case.  No comment on the quality of food by the time we sat down to eat it.

Mother&#39;s Day FIASCO!!  Placed an online order given a pick up time for 6:00. We arrive on time for our 6:00 curbside pick up.  Was told by multiple employees we would receive a text when order was ready.  2 hours and 30 minutes later we are finally informed our order &#34;NEVER went through&#34;!!! we had a order confirmation number!!  What a total waste of time.  The least The Cheesecake Factory could have done was offered us a couple FREE slices of their cheesecake.  Hope we were not charged for order we never got.

We went here for my son&#39;s birthday. There were 4 of us. We started with an order of Mac and cheese balls for an appetizer-so good! Then, one of us got the Bang Bang chicken and rice which is a large serving of a mild curry with a choice of white or brown rice. This is a favorite of our family and it never disappoints. Daughter got the steak tacos. She said they were good. Son and I got a specially featured dish...Chicken Parmesan pizza style. Check out my picture! It was a huge crust of chicken with sauce, Parmesan cheese and pasta...so good and so large that I have 1/2 for lunch tomorrow. We love the brown bread best but their sourdough is tangy too. We took cheesecake home so we can&#39;t review that but we know that will be great.

Yum!!!!!! Got the egg roll sampler and wooooo weeeee!!! So good and unique. Even the free bread was super swoft and yum. More than enough to get you full lol. Luckily the entrees took forever to come out so I was hungry again by that time. I got the jumbalaya. Omg that was so amazing. Green noodles and everything. They make even better leftovers. I&#39;m serious. I feel like the flavor had more time to soak in lol. And of course the cheesecake was grand . Had to get that to go though. There&#39;s a lot of food served here lol.

Ate here Friday, early afternoon (July 12). My favorite is the avocado club and I love how they toast the bread perfectly. Tex Mex egg rolls were good and you have to try the Georgia Peach cocktail which is really refreshing and tasty. But the best thing was our waitress. She was so great, I wish I could remember her name. Blonde and going to school for her degree in SW.

Cheesecake Factory is always a consistent choice.  Our experience this time was not that great.  We waited for a table for 45 mins with our 3 young children, during our wait we looked at a menu so we knew what to order the minute we sat down.  Once sat we ordered right away (2 kids Mac n cheese, spaghetti and meatballs, cheesesteak sandwich and a salmon salad pretty simple stuff) We did not get our food for 45 minutes.  When we got our food it was hot which was nice but just ok when it came to flavor.  The manager walked by our table 3 times during our wait and never once stopped and asked how things were or gave us updates on what was going on with our order.  We just didn&#39;t feel like they cared.

I placed an online order.  It.said our order would be ready at 245pm.  We arrived in time and couldn&#39;t even make it into the parking lot.  I had to park across the street.  I walked up towards the restaurant and there were around 30 people outside waiting, after about 15 minutes an employee finally said I would get a text when the order was ready. About 15minutes later I received a text saying it was ready. When I was walking back to my car accross the street there were cars lined up all the way to metcalf.     When we got home our order was cold. Not a good experience.

I ordered Avocado Eggrolls after looking at some past reviews. Unfortunately, the flour wrap wasn&#39;t deep fried and was badly chewy. I was able to eat just one of them and threw the rest away. This wasn&#39;t something I expected for the hefty 12$ they charge. <br>I&#39;m a big fan of their Godiva cheesecake though.

Always excellent food, but I&#39;m sure most of the world knows this since every time we go to one there is at least an hour wait. I wish based on popularity that they would open a 3rd location, maybe Kansas City North? Anyway my go-to dish is the Chicken Pasta Carbonara. It&#39;s so delicious and I don&#39;t come very often due to the sheer price $20.50 a plate, so I can&#39;t say I have a lot of experience with the many endless pages of items to order. I&#39;ve heard the Macaroni and Cheese topped Burger is one of the best in town. My kids always get the Fettuccini Alfredo and rave about it. The cheesecake is delicious and so many choices there as well.

Another disappointing visit.  <br><br>We came at around 3:30 PM and fortunately only had about a five minute wait in the lobby. We were seated in one of our favorite areas (we call it the rotunda) of the restaurant. And our waiter was quite exceptional. Unfortunately that&#39;s not the tale of this experience.<br><br>Our experience started strong.  We always order the Korean Cauliflower and our two orders did not disappoint- hot and delicious.  Our waiter brought us extra sourdough bread at our request and kept our ice teas topped off.<br><br>The disappointment came when they brought our meals.  My wife ordered the fish and chips.  She had been looking forward to this meal for several days.  The fish was inedible.  The first piece wouldn&#39;t even cut. It was tough.  She tried to tear open a second piece to also find it was tough.  The fries were cold as well.  We complained to our waiter.  He was sympathetic.   He offered for them to cook another order.  She was turned off.  Instead she ordered a flatbread pizza to go.<br><br>My Caribbean Jerk Chicken and Shrimp was okay.  It lacked flavor.  I didn&#39;t complain and ate my meal while my wife watched.<br><br>Needless to say my wife didn&#39;t get what she wanted.  She wanted a quality order of Fish and Chips.  We left without ordering cheesecake (a fairly standard thing we do - desert to go).  We would have probably used the entire $100 gift card if the food was consistent with prior vi<br><br>I saw a previous good post about their experience with consistency.  I wish we had consistency in our food expectations.

I love this location. The food is always worth the price and the service is always good. Too many great choices, so deciding what to order is hard. The cheese cake is great, but don&#39;t sleep on the other desserts!

Cheesecake is always sooo good. Godiva is the only one to get though as it&#39;s the best. I never have set down I always only get cheesecake. They are always so busy so it takes awhile but that&#39;s not their fault.

Cheesecake Factory is a good place to go to if you&#39;re trying to satisfy multiple taste palates, because there&#39;s something for everyone here. Not all of their dishes are super great though, but I would recommend the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, Chicken Bellagio, Crusted Chicken Romano and Fish Tacos. They seem to excel at making pastas (it&#39;s also pretty hard to mess up pasta); all of their other dishes are honestly pretty mediocre. For an appetizer, I would get the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes. But their dishes come in huge portions so you&#39;re better off skipping the appetizer to save room for dessert.<br><br>I highly recommend coming here at an off time. Service can be really slow during peak times. Yes, there are plenty of tables and you&#39;ll be seated quickly but it can take up to 30 minutes to get your food.

Consistency is key, which is why Cheesecake Factory deserves some praise. <br><br>ATMOSPHERE: One thing I can reliably depend on is every location&#39;s layout. They&#39;re all basically identical, so one can predict what it will look like. This restaurant is usually busy, so don&#39;t expect peace and quiet. One thing which disappointed me about this location was the lack of reservations or even call-ahead seating. <br><br>SERVICE: I&#39;m usually pleased with the service at any CF location, and this one was no different. Everything was quick and timely.<br><br>FOOD: in keeping with the consistency theme, the food quality is reliably predictable. The chicken piccata here tasted as I remembered it elsewhere. Finding something delectable here is also not a difficult task as the menu is rather large. When a restaurant offers a myriad of choices while simultaneously delivering the same good quality at any location it&#39;s a positive sign. <br><br>VALUE: This is CF&#39;s biggest obstacle holding them back from a perfect five stars. Everything here is pricey for the portion size, but I understand why. People flock to this chain in droves, so there isn&#39;t an incentive to price items more competitively, and this makes me curious to see what happens as we enter this bear market. There is also a good reason why everything on their menu except alcohol has listed prices. Typical cocktails here go for $11-12, and they&#39;re not top shelf and/or large either. It&#39;s still kind of baffling to see New York City drink prices in BFE.

Really great food and service. I had the Parmesan chicken sandwich and salad with vine-gret dressing and both were outstanding. The sand which was on a fluffy yet crispy roll and they gave extra red sauce to dip it in. A couple of different types of bread as appetizers.  The cheesecake - I was told - was outstanding. Three different kinds at my table including red velvet, lime and regular. Just a great place with a pleasing interior.

Being from a small(er) town, I recall my early experiences with Cheesecake Factory being a BIG DEAL.  When my wife (then-girlfriend) moved to Kansas City from the aforementioned village, nearly every big experience was celebrated with a dinner date out to the Cheesecake Factory on the Country Club Plaza in The Big City.  We gladly suffered through three-hour-and-thirty-minute waits on Saturday night, just to be &#34;on the Plaza&#34; and seemingly more awesome than all the pitiful fools we left behind from our misspent (mis-located?) youth.<br><br>The basics haven&#39;t changed in 10 years - nice, clean venues, consistent decor, strong service, enormous menu covering cuisine from all seven continents, and, yes, hunger-pain-inducing long waits on the weekends.<br><br>My last three visits have all been relatively more of the same, with the exception that each one missed a step in one of the above areas.  On the former two occasions, the food quality had seemingly dropped off a tick. For a decade, I would have rated it 4/5 stars, but it&#39;s dropped to 3 - 3.5.  Still strong, especially considering the breadth of menu options the obviously-skilled CF chefs have to be able to create, but down a notch.  Quantity is still enormous, which is to say just fine.<br><br>On my latest visit, I feel we were slighted on the usual above-average service end of things.  Our waitress was a little more in tune to the pompadour-haired bartender than her waiting duties, both on our table and others&#39;.  You may be thinking, &#34;But, M.O., you yourself pointed out just how crazy-busy the Cheesecake Factory is!&#34;  Yes, Yelp brethren, while this is normally true, on this occasion it was a mid-winter Thursday evening from 9:00 to 11:00 pm in the bar.  We were but one of three spots in the entire bar area taking up space.  So few tables to tend to should have meant better-than-average service, however we received the opposite. <br><br>Nitpicks aside, Cheesecake Factory remains a strong, albeit predictable, choice for a good meal alongside half the metropolitan area.  <br><br>TIP: Get the cheesecake. Any of them. Obvious, yes, but almost so much so that you might be tempted to eat that entire 14-pound plate of delicious pasta instead of leaving room for dessert.  There&#39;s a reason the dessert name made the façade, folks!<br><br>Food = 3/5 <br>Facility = 4/5<br>Service = 2/5<br>Ambiance = 3/5<br>Value = 4/5

For being the first time to the cheesecake factory. I had a disappointing experience, nothing from the service but the kitchen itself. All of the rumors I&#39;ve heard as a culinarian myself, came true tonight. Not only is the menu OVERWHELMING, but I did settle on the Riesling Chicken. The first plate came out cool and the chicken and sauce were barely warm. Returned the plate to the expo myself, informed the restaurant manager that intercepted the plate that it wasn&#39;t even to minimum service temp(140°). And I asked for a fresh refire. Received the plate back roughly only 5-6 minutes later. When I inspected the plate I found evidence of a reheat not a refire. The inner rim showed signs of crusting from the sauce, instant indicator of being either nuked(microwaved) or just thrown into the oven to bring it up to heat. I refused the plate after the waitress returned with my to go box.

If this was my only trip to the Cheesecake Factory it would be my last. Our waitress was the worst I&#39;ve ever had, she screwed up my order, forgot my request for extra dressing, failed to show up to our table most of the evening and spent a significant portion of the time talking to the table behind us. We wanted to order another drink for the majority of the evening and she walked by and only asked my partner for what he needed and walked away before I could even respond. She gave him his drink and walked away before I could attempt to get her attention. The meal was disgusting, I ordered my longtime favorite and it came out without two key ingredients and heavily over salted. <br><br>This was the worst trip I&#39;ve had to a Cheesecake Factory in more than 5 states and it&#39;s the last time I will be returning to this location. Others are generally great, this one is the weird exception to the rule. One thing I will note - I&#39;ve had great service at the bar. <br><br>After letting the waitress know something was wrong with the meal the manager came out to check and removed it from the bill. That is the one saving grace!

Made a reservation for 8 got here checked in and ended up just leaving at 830 I thought the whole point of a reservation was to be seated at a decent time apparently not here on top of that the lady working the front acted like she didn&#39;t even care when we told her we where leaving. I&#39;ve been here before and the food is great but if you decide to make a reservation here be prepared to wait as if you didn&#39;t we will not be coming back here.

This is and has for years been in my top 5 places to eat.  Unfortunately (or fortunately, for my waist line) we don&#39;t have one in Wichita, so I have to wait until we are in KC or Vegas to eat here.  I prefer this location over the Plaza one simply because it&#39;s easier to access and seems to have a quicker turnaround.<br><br>The problem with the huge menu where everything sounds delicious is that because I so rarely get to eat here, I have to order the meal that put this place in my top 1% in the first place...the Chicken Picatta.  (I just got goosebumps typing that...cue the drool cup).  Yeah...it&#39;s a major cheat meal for this gluten-intolerant gut of mine...but soooo worth it!.  <br><br>I did one time order something gluten free which has now become my hubby&#39;s go-to after he tried mine.  That&#39;s the Steak Diane...it&#39;s pretty damn drool-worthy itself.  <br><br>We always get a couple of different cheesecakes as well...one to share and one to take with us.  This time we had one of our trusty regulars, the Banana Cream...it&#39;s not as rich as some, so we can actually finish it in one setting.  Then we took a new choice, Chris&#39;s Outrageous with us...if you like Mounds candy bars or German chocolate cake, this one will tickle your fancy.  Can you really go wrong with any cheesecake that has some combo of chocolate, caramel, peanut butter, or chunks of some candy bar?  Me thinks not.

Very beautiful place. Was packed but was still worth the wait. For a Saturday it was going to be more then a 50min wait but we lucked out and got open bar seating. Our waiter was super polite and really helpful. Definitely going back.

You come here for the dessert menu.  The white chocolate raspberry cheesecake is my personal fave.  Lots to choose from, all of it delicious.<br><br>Everything else is pretty uninspired.  On my last visit, my chicken-mango-avocado salad featured little chunks of rock-hard underripe mango, an overcooked stringy piece of chicken, and a vinaigrette that was so tart it was actually painful to eat.  They also told us that the first part of our party hadn&#39;t arrived, just before we spotted them sitting at a large table.  (They don&#39;t take reservations, so you have to send advance scouts for a large lunch group.)  Service at lunch was painfully slow &amp; disorganized.  Not in a hurry to go back.

The Drinks are always fenomenal here. <br>I would really recommend there Mojitos - super Refreshing. I also tried there Long Island and it was super strong - great drink.  <br>Am not too crazy about their food it&#39;s a Hit and Miss for me, Sometimes you get Good food others Ok food. <br>Drinks and Desserts are always fantastic only reason why I keep coming back !
We had a party of 8.  Our server did a great job- he had 2 large parties sat at once. Bread is delicious. Servings are plenty

Apps were excellent (eggroll sampler), drinks were great (cucumber lemonade) entrees were bad. Way overcooked. Biscuits burnt in chicken and biscuits. Pasta hard...very hard.. in chicken marsala. Manager never came by to apologize after sending meal back. 2nd remakes were better but took over 30 minutes to make. Had to ask for drink refills everytime. Bad service. Just overall not great despite empty restaurant on a Saturday night. :(

We had a friend get together and picked here on a Saturday night. Not my first choice because it is so big and so busy. But it was so, so good. I was afraid of the menu as well, big portions, lots of calories, then cheesecake. I was happy to see the skinnilicious menu, so shrimp tacos it was. Very good! And I skipped the dessert, although took a couple home for the fam. Ian waited on us and did such a great job. Great experience!!!!

Once again TCF does not disappoint. The worst process for seating, I mean making people wait in the industry. I was convinced to give it a try again after 3 years and nothing has changed. Plenty of empty tables, servers chatting at the hostess stand, told a 10 to 15 minute wait, left after 25 minutes.  The food is not that good. I will spend my money elsewhere.

I just feel like it is hard to go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. There are so many options, your whole party will find something to eat. I&#39;ve never had a bad experience with any of the dishes I have ordered at the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>My family and I made a weekend trip to Kansas City and we came here. We knew we wanted to come here, since we use to live in CA near a few cheesecake factories and then moved to AR with no cheesecake factories. We were really excited to come eat!<br><br>WAIT/PARKING:<br>We came on a Saturday evening around 6ish. It was really crowded, but we didn&#39;t have too long of a wait fortunately. About 30 minutes. <br><br>The restaurant is located in a small shopping center. There is a decent amount of parking, but it is a busy restaurant, so parking can be hard to find. We had to park near Whole Foods, which is in the back of cheesecake - not far.<br><br>CUSTOMER SERVICE:<br>Our waiter gave us great customer service. Very friendly and helpful.<br><br>FOOD:<br>I&#39;ve ordered quite a few dishes at Cheesecake Factory. Lately, I&#39;ve mainly been ordering off of the skinnylicious menu. Can&#39;t beat yummy and healthy! I&#39;ve had several items off of this menu and they have all been delicious and filling. This trip I ordered the Asian Chicken Salad. So yummy, ate it all! It was a large portion too. Which, btw, all of cheesecake factory dishes are good size portions. Usually you will have left overs. <br><br>My husband ordered the Italian Sandwich and loved it. <br><br>We had our 2 year old daughter with us. At all restaurant locations they bring out a smaller plate of fruit and bread to you if you have a small child. Not sure whicha age is the cut off for that. It is such a nice gesture and I appreciate them taking that extra step to treat the kids good and help the parents out ;).<br><br>Then we ordered cheesecake... I mean c&#39;mon, how can you pass it up when dining here! I&#39;ve had a good amount of cheesecakes here and they are all yummy. This time I ordered the Hershey&#39;s Cheesecake - oh my yum! My husband had the Reese&#39;s Peanut Buttercup Chocolate Cheesecake- also very delicious. We had leftovers from our cheesecakes. Very delicious, but both rich that we weren&#39;t able to finish them. However, I finished mine later for my &#34;4th&#34; meal haha. <br><br>Other cheesecakes I love: fresh strawberry, s&#39;more, 30th anniversary, godiva, raspberry, peanut butter cup fudge, and chocolate mousse. I also love the linda&#39;s fudge cake and lemoncello cream torte.

So I sat at the bar for my food and was not offered bread and butter however when someone came in and sat next to me they offered them bread and butter. I ordered a chocolate martini and the bar tender didn&#39;t know how to make it and ask another worker to do it. The bartenders were so busy making drink that they didn&#39;t acknowledge the people needs at the bar for food. I will not be at this location anytime soon. Plus long wait for my drink

Food was delicious as usual. Had to wait a bit on a Saturday afternoon, wasn&#39;t expecting that but not a big deal. Server was fast and made sure we had everything we needed. And then the cheesecake. You can&#39;t go wrong with any one you choose!
Surprisingly impressed, service, food, drinks. Chicken marsala and pineapple mojito were my favs. It was a great meal!

One the best restaurants ever! The brown bread is to die for and the four cheese pasta has a ton of flavor. The waiters are very good as well! Expect a small wait especially in the evening and weekends. There&#39;s a reason for that! The food and cheese cake is just that good!

I&#39;m so disappointed. We waited an hour and a half. When we went to check how much longer our wait was we were told very rudely &#34;I told you an hour and a half&#34;. Then when brought to the table the hostess said nothing, she stopped with no signal that this was our table. When we didn&#39;t sit she used her hand to gesture, I said thank you and she just rolled her eyes then started walking away. We then waited 15 minutes for our waiter, he was really nice. We ordered drinks and our food. We ordered the calamari (something I order every time I go to Cheesecake Factory) and it came out a greasy mess the breading wasn&#39;t even on the meat. Then our food came and had the same issue. It looked like crap and mine (bang-bang chicken and shrimp) was cold. Waiter didn&#39;t come back for a while. I ate a little of my food then just asked for a box. The waiter was trying to rush us out. I normally really enjoy this place but I am very unimpressed with this location&#39;s staff and quality of food.

Honestly, the Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. We always ask for our Cheesecake first that way we can munch on it while we&#39;re eating for our entree so we aren&#39;t too full to eat it after! The free bread is the best, and the menu is endless. Everything I&#39;ve ever tried is phenomenal.

Check your receipts! Left a $10 tip on a $50 order, but when I checked my bank statement, the waitress had been given a $26 tip. Manager said she will refund the money in 7-10 days, but feel that the problem still exists.

Sadly the service and the portions have gone down dramatically in te last few years. I decided to order take out from a local delivery service and for the second time in a row they have forgotton the complimentary bread. The first time I was forgiving but twice in a row? I called the resturant and the manager who identified himself as Chris Welch stated it was not their responsibility to make sure the order was complete, it was the delivery services job. Sure that&#39;s why I pay over $18 with tax for their overpriced Cashew Chicken. Give me a break, its the resturants responsibility to make sure the order is correct, its the driversjob to make sure its delivered to the right house. I do not recommend this location, its service and portions are horrible.

Hits the sweet tooth spot with an endless choice of cheesecakes. <br><br>Can&#39;t go wrong with a late night piece of cheesecake and coffee. Service is always good, not much they can do but give us dessert! <br><br>We got the 30 year anniversary piece. It was VERY cold and the fudge layer was completely over powering. Next time I will just get plain ole&#39; cheesecake.
Burnt or Not......you decide....sure looks like it to me. The waitress stuck with her story that they just crisp it up for you. Hmmmnnnn

One of our favs has devolved into a no-go for us. We&#39;ve been going since this opened and now everytime we visit, we get the same story: we&#39;ve changed the recipe! Nothing we order tastes as good as it did in the restaurant&#39;s beginnings. We&#39;ve decided we will only visit when we&#39;re in the mood for cheesecake.

The Tuscan chicken was phenomenal. My wife had the grilled chicken Asian salad and that was good too -- it became truly great after our server suggested the Chinese plum dressing. <br><br>Great food and service. Good for families with smaller kids too.<br><br>The server we had (Brad) is one of the best we have had anywhere in the country.
We love this place! The &#34;chicken and biscuits&#34; is delicious and comfy. The artichoke and crab dip omg soooo good! Hubby got mac n cheese burger he said it was delicious!

I&#39;ve eaten Cheesecake Factory for years and this is the first one I&#39;ve eaten at that served an undercooked(pink all the way through) burger to my wife. The server was good about getting another burger but it took about ten minutes(which I understand but by the time she got her food I was already done eating). The next burger came out and was still a little red in the middle so my wife just asked for a to go box as we didn&#39;t have time to wait again. It&#39;s a little upsetting to go to such a nice restaurant and spend $80 between two people and not even have a manager come apologize.  I won&#39;t give one star as our waitress seemed like she tried and the orange chicken I ordered was phenomenal, however in the future we won&#39;t be returning to this location.

Horrible. All staff and management are disorganized. Please don&#39;t use this restaurant. I waited over an hour to receive my food from curbside, no one know what&#39;s going on very unorganized and untrained STAFF. Especially front desk older lady!!!!!!!!Very unprofessional how this matter was handled.

I prefer this location over the plaza location, especially for weekend dinners (the wait is out the door on the plaza then). <br><br>I&#39;ve always had a pleasant experience here and the marble interior with high-ceiling and pillars are a nice touch. <br><br>They have their lunch specials every day until 5 p.m.<br><br>I will say, the menu reads like a chapter book with ads separating the genres of food they offer. So if you&#39;re indecisive, tell the waiter you&#39;ll need more than a minute. On top of that, they have plenty of awesome dishes to choose from, which doesn&#39;t make the process any easier. <br><br>I&#39;ve found that all the pastas, have had them all, are fantastic. My favorite pasta is the Carbonara and Da Vinci. <br><br>If you&#39;re feeling adventurous, you can have your dessert before your meal. As you walk into the place, they have their cheesecake bar on the right side, before you&#39;re greeted by their front-end staff.<br><br>My favorite cheesecake they offer, currently have 60+ cheesecake flavors and always adding/substituting, is the Banana Cheesecake. It&#39;s a cheesecake with a hint of banana flavor with whip cream and fresh bananas cut on top of the cream. So good. If you don&#39;t see your favorite cheesecake on there anymore, you should ask to see if they still offer it. <br><br>For the quality of the food and immense choices, the price is very reasonable. I usually spend around $55-60 for a date night, with big meals, dessert and an occasional appetizer + tip.

Rudest bartender I&#39;ve ever had and I&#39;ve been around a long time! Catty comments and snotty attitudes will not get this presumably young woman very far. Extremely disappointed and we will not recommend this location...ever. By the way, I live locally. I waited tables for 3 years, so I understand your pain. But show up and fake it if you have to, but like it or not, this is corporate America and you better learn quick! I still tipped even though it wasn&#39;t earned!

I haven&#39;t been here before. My husband and I came to celebrate my birthday/our anniversary and use a gift card I had received. <br><br>Wait time wasn&#39;t bad for a Friday night - and they got us in much quicker than estimated. The hostess wasn&#39;t super friendly, but also not chilly. I get it, it was super busy and she has a hard job with (probably) no tip-out. <br><br>Our server was really nice, very attentive, answered all of our questions, and brought us a little hot fudge sundae to celebrate. The food was good, but not fantastic. However, the lettuce wraps were amazing. Giving a three because I just wasn&#39;t wowed, was pretty loud, and felt cramped. It&#39;s a tad pricy, though the serving sizes are big.

I used to love this place. One of the few chains that really was good.<br><br>Now the thirty page menu is nothing more then chicken dishes in various forms. They&#39;ve been Houlihan&#39;d. No place overuses chicken like Houlihan&#39;s, now Cheesecake Factory rivals them. You can see how well this strategy has worked for Houlihan&#39;s. The menu is a page after laminated page of soulless beige dishes. Nearly all of their signature dishes are chicken unless you added some shrimp. Portions used to be enough for three meals. Not anymore. This is a one setting dish now. This place isn&#39;t cheap. For the portion size they presently serve it is way overpriced. I know money is the common denominator but I urge Cheesecake management to remember what made them popular because if they don&#39;t I see signs of their inevitable decline. In five years they could easily go the way of Red Lobster or worse.

Okay I still have a bit of an issue giving it 5 stars because the cheesecake was almost $10, but overall it was a good value. We ordered two pasta dishes that were on special and my ex ordered his spicy. Both were awesome and we had enough for another meal that night. We split the Oreo cheesecake and ate it over two days. It was decadent. The service was professional and pleasant and the establishment was clean. I&#39;d recommend and can&#39;t wait to return
Doordash orders are never ready!! I have been here 2-3 times to pick up a doordash order and the wait time is 10-15 minutes. They will promise you a pick up time and it won&#39;t be promised!
Black people be prepared to wait the maximum time possible. Just a trend with this location. Which is why this will be my LAST visit here, which I&#39;m sure was the plan.

This place continues to be over-rated. At 1:30 on a Sunday afternoon it has taken us almost 1.5 hours to eat a an overpriced burger, grilled cheese and fish &amp; chips. Nothing special ordered. We are still waiting for cheesecake-which is really the only reason we came here. Not to mention lack luster service and a table next to us with a 2 year old little boy who was either screaming or running wild thru the restaurant-while his family pretended nothing was happening.  Definitely not a pleasant dining experience. <br>Next time we will order cheesecake to go. Lesson learned.

Slooooooooowwwwww. Is the best way to describe this visit. Servers are moving in slow motion. Took 20 minutes to get the bread on the table and an additional 40 minutes to get the food out and on a day that isn&#39;t even busy. Management needs to reevaluate their staff at this location.

My cousin invited me to the Cheesecake Factory because his little brother took his snack at our school and he was starving from hunger. His mother suggest that we could eat dinner there. I didn&#39;t know that this place was too popular(not saying it&#39;s bad). The atmosphere was fancy and ancient. The waiting line was so long, but the colorful place made me busy looking around the castle-looking restaurant.<br><br> We finally got our table and talk a little bit of life. The waiter walked to our table and gave out our drinks. He was so kind that he gave us some bread and butter over time. While we wait, I got on my phone, but there&#39;s no internet. I ask the waiter. He said that they don&#39;t have the internet because people will stay here all night. So my cousin and I talked about each other, sometimes we get a restroom break. <br><br>After a long time of waiting, talking, and seeking any interesting decorations, we got our food. As I started to gobble like my friend (I call my cousin that sometimes), my mom said the pizza was a bit too salty. I ate half of the pizza, a quarter of a salad, and almost all of the noodles. For dessert, the cheesecake was smooth and crispy good with the fresh strawberry and taste fruity. I left home like I had obesity. If you want a restaurant like this place, my top 5 suggest that this place might be your loyal kitchen.

I have already contacted cheesecake online after my experience for further assistance, and haven&#39;t heard anything for a week...shows how horrible their customer service is on top of the restaurant itself. Don&#39;t write on our reviews on yelp to contact you online if your not going to respond back. People deserve to know the lack of your service. Theres plenty of other restaurants in town that care more about their customers than you.

Went here recently for take-out dessert only. When you walk in, there is an area where you can order cheesecake and other fresh desserts from their display cases. We ordered two different kinds of cheesecake and after a few minutes, they were given to us with a side of whipped cream. The service was as fast as it could be with an adequate amount of staff taking care of multiple customer orders. The cheesecake itself it well worth the wait and arguably worth the price (which is relatively high). They typically rotate through different flavors but keep majority of their menu the same. I have always loved coming to the Cheesecake Factory primarily for the cheesecake and this is usually the first place I think of when I think of great cheesecake.

My favorite Cheesecake Factory location. Great food and service. I&#39;ve had Taylor as a waiter several times and he is amazing. This would be a lock 5***** but the hostess is awful! Rude the last three times and I&#39;ve got out of my way to treat her as a customer and it just gets worse. <br><br>The avocado egg rolls are crazy!<br><br>Cheers

Our dinner at 9:00 PM took over an hour and a half to get to us (party of 3). We had to ask to place our order and had to ask for all of our drink refills. One entree was good, one entree was sent back because the pasta was so over cooked that it actually was starting to kind of paste together, then one entree had been sitting out so long a film had settled in on the pasta. A manager never even acknowledged the fact that a dish was sent back and not replaced. We will not be coming back here after this experience. A party of ten came in after us and was able to leave before we did.

I thought I&#39;d order cheesecake for New Year&#39;s Eve before all the New Years resolutions.  I ordered for pick up and they said it would be ready in 20 min.  When I arrived, several people were waiting for their food, or for their delivery driver was waiting.  While I was still line a couple different people who were waiting asked the people at the register to relook in the food packages that were next to the register.  Before looking the guy at the register said no their name wasn&#39;t there, and then thought better of himself and looked, found three peoples order.  It had been sitting there the whole time they had been waiting 30 min.  I paid and got my cheesecake but my food I was told was being packed up in the kitchen.  They had a lot to do- I was told.  The kitchen was backed up.  So I waited...and waited...about the time I was going to ask for a manager, the girl at the register went back herself to see where the orders were.  She brought out some, but still not mine.  I finally got my order an 70 min after I placed it.  It must have been sitting in the back the whole time because when I got it it was cold.  I feel real bad for the Grubhub/delivery drivers- their people are gonna think they took too long when in fact it was the Cheesecake Factory.

I usually always have a good experience here! The only thing I would say is that it gets super busy on some days and they don&#39;t take reservations. I ordered the bang bang shrimp and chicken.. It tasted like a curry flavor to me, but still good! Just not what I was expecting what the usual &#34;bang bang shrimp&#34; to taste like. We also ordered Korean cauliflower to eat and it&#39;s a good replacement for meat! I loved how it tasted with ranch. My friend ordered honey truffle chicken and it was delicious! The chicken was very flavorful. And of course we ordered cheesecake togo... The white chocolate rasberry truffle &amp; mango key lime coconut. Very satisfied with how everything tasted!
Food is always excellent and cheesecake is even better. It&#39;s pretty pricey but you must assume that before eating here anyways!

It&#39;s a really nice to be if u love cakes especially cheesecakes. It does justice to its name. Lemme first talk about the ambience as it&#39;s the first thing you notice. It&#39;s built over a huge area and it&#39;s Egyptian themed. Very pretty. The staff is well spoken. You will never run out of options as they have a huge menu. But if you are a vegetarian or a vegan better reconsider before going there.<br>I went there with my husband and we ordered avocado egg rolls for starters. They were really really good. For the main course we had a veggie burger and noodles. Finally ending with a delicious tiramisu cheesecake.

Went in and ask to watch the World Series and sat there thru 2 innings and bartender still didn&#39;t change channel. <br><br>I left<br><br>I believe in 2nd chances... in this case 3. My hotel is near by and this is my place of choice due to the selection of menu. That first time was a disappointment however have come back twice now and service and food have been great.  And they had they&#39;ve had the World Series on! :)

I used to come here a lot. Had a roomie worked here always got brought home a cheesecake slice on evenings he worked. Recent visit I tried the low carb cheesecake although I am not a fan of Splenda I knew I would feel terrible if I ate a whole slice of regular cheesecake (no joke, been Keto almost a year now). So I wasn&#39;t disappointed with the choice. It was really just like cheesecake. If only they would expand the low carb cheesecake menu and use erithritol. I would be by more often.

ZERO STARS - when the food arrived it smelled like dishwater but despite this we ate a little and it was super bland, the noodles were hard, non of us finished our food because of this and 3 OUT OF 6 OF OUR PARTY GOT FOOD POISONING FROM THE ALFREDO !!! I can&#39;t imagine how much more sick we would have been if we did finish our plates, Be safe than sorry DONT EAT HERE!!!

Heard good things about this place. Wasn&#39;t what I hoped for saying he least. Coffee was good. Spicy cashew chicken was not all that good chicken was soft like cooked fish fair on the taste. White chocolate raspberry truffle cheese cake had no raspberry taste to it at all not even a hint. Def not worth 16.95 for chicken and 7.95 for cake. Will not be going back again

Can see why rating is 3 1/2 stars, on a beautiful night management decide not to serve on the patio and staff appropriately? Lobby is packed and patio is full of hungry customers waiting to eat inside plus it&#39;s prom night.  Told our wait is 45 minutes,  I expect it will be an hour and half before we are seated.  No staff to even offer waiting customers on patio a drink.  Use to love this place but not with the current management concern for customer service.

I have been here once and it was many years ago it was okay but it didn&#39;t appeal to me and I haven&#39;t been back , people like this place and it&#39;s busy too so that must be good, might go in on there cheesecake half price special, it&#39;s easy to get in and out of the place, so I really can&#39;t give u answer if it good or not on this place
Awsome food like the taste but wait time was bit much .loved the ambience and cocktail

Had a great experience tonight. Dinner for 5 and when our meal was ready one dish was sent to a different table. Everyone from Manager to wait staff did what they could to make the mistake better. Not a perfect meal but perfectly handled with customer service. Service and doing what is right by your customers is a lost skills but not here.  A great experience in spite of a kitchen mix up.

First impression: the tile path leading to the door has several broken, missing and loose pieces. I&#39;m surprised someone hasn&#39;t fallen. <br>They were strangely busy for a Thursday night, about a 15 minute wait.<br>Finally the hostess called our name and we get to our table and its still being cleared. Then we sat down to a wet table. Not a good start. <br>The burger I ordered was good and cooked to order. My date got the fish and it was horrible. We put it aside and shared my plate. Service was bare minimum. <br>I love this place but I do NOT recommend this location.

Decent amount of parking.  Wait was realistic and accurate with the time given.  Excellent service.  Not cheap, but the size of the portions is a value.  Very able to  accommodate special dietary and allergy requirements.  Exceeded expectations.
Nice decor and food is okay but it doesn&#39;t equal the price they charge. <br><br>Anyplace that charges $18 for meat loaf ought to be able to get my order right the first time.

We came here for lunch! We ordered the pasta  which was wonderful. The only issue was that we had ordered the lunch sized pasta and when we received our food, I was thinking this amount of food was large. I asked our waitress what a dinner sized meal looked like if this was lunch amount. She apologized and stated that she made the mistake that she marked the dinner size. We were thinking because it was her mistake she would make the correction on our receipt to lunch. Unfortunately she did not! Please be very clear to what size you are going to order to your waitress or waiter.. Our bill was on the pricey side because of this. I understand that mistakes can happen but fix it for your customer.

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory. If you&#39;ve been to one, you&#39;ve pretty much been to all of them. <br><br>Food was on par, and service has always been good at this location. <br><br>They have a large menu so there&#39;s usually always something for everyone. <br><br>Lets be honest, I don&#39;t go to TCF for the food, it&#39;s for the cheesecake. I will be back.
Great food all around. Amazing appetizers, entrees, and of course all the cheesecake options. I can see why they are always extremely busy.

Wanted to enjoy some carry-out and thought this would be my best option, but definitely not! The Avocado Egg Rolls I ordered looked like they&#39;ve been sitting out since this morning, completely brown and the cheese cake I had ordered was smashed.

The Cheesecake Factory does a lot of business in the Overland Park, KS area. Please be more focused on the Customer coming into your location and acknowledge them , Waiting time is terriable. You hired to many employees and they never respond to the Customers or Drivers that you have contracted with to deliver food to your customers. The drivers provide a service and the owner of the restaurant needs to inform your staff to provide better service for Door Dash, Grub Hub, and Huber. The drivers provide excellent service . They do not get paid to wait on you to bring the food up front. So be more considerate and have better communication to the people coming into to your restaurant. Hiring to many people makes no sense if you have upset customer waiting for long periods of time.

I&#39;m very easy to please but very disappointed yesterday when we went with a group the booth we sit at was very dirty the sit still have foods crumbs on it and my plate has food stuck on it that is been dry up we ask our waiter for a new one and we have to clean our silverware I&#39;m very disappointed.

Emotionally unstable and forgetful staff.   One woman had trouble taking a basic order (didn&#39;t seem to be able to add and subtract).  An overload of tension in the environment, and the manager himself wasn&#39;t familiar with the menu.

I have lived other places and loved cheesecake, but the two cheesecake&#39;s here that I&#39;ve been to (119th and plaza) are repeatedly poor. Food is often way too salty, I&#39;ve had stale hamburger buns, cold fries,etc. repeatedly. I stop going and a couple months later, give it another try (like today) and find nothing has changed.  It is clear that the managers here simply are not interested in any aspect of running a good restaurant. It is a shame as it used to be one of my favorite restaurants before I moved here. This is clearly a local problem and I find the apathy pretty sad. I wish corporate would pay attention and intervene. Maybe time for new managers!!!

First: we had a great waiter the other day. He was friendly, respectful, and suggested his favorite blend of tea. My mom loves tea more than most people can conceptualize, and she was very impressed. She requested that I add this review. <br><br>Second: Oh, Cheesecake Factory. If only I could live my dreams and eat your cheesecake for breakfast everyday. There&#39;s nothing like rolling out of bed and enjoying a slice of key lime cheesecake while dancing in your kitchen, preferably at the counter closest to your refrigerator. It&#39;s divine. You&#39;ve been there to celebrate birthdays, births, divorces, and everything in between. You remain a constant. I&#39;m sure this is the new Red Lobster of single 20-30 something females, but you never judge. Keep that brown bread and cheesecake coming, and everything will be just fine.

Gave CF another try with a gift card I had received. Went during their Happy Hour, which I had never done before. Was seated in a quiet booth with just a short wait. Was pleased to see Mark West Pinot noir as a $5 HH wine option. Had the spring rolls as a HH app, were very good. Had lots of veggies like bean sprouts and mushrooms, liked the soy and peanut sauce for dipping. I once again wanted the tuna tataki salad, but they were out of tuna. (There is a theme here.) Had the Thai salmon instead, very large portion of fish and was well cooked. Hubby had the shepherds pie, and we took a slice of lemon meringue cheesecake to go. As always, their cheesecake is the best. Service was wonderful. I will be back.
This location never empty, always busy. I love their bread, warm and fresh. Good portion, good price and friendly service. <br><br>Don&#39;t forget to get the cheesecake!

Had lunch there today, it was alright.  My husband and I noticed that the knives, a napkin, and one of the appetizer plates on the table were obviously filthy, so we had to ask for clean replacements right off the bat when we sat down.<br><br>A short note - they have tons of dishes to choose from, so unless you&#39;re a regular or you absolutely love a very specific dish, be prepared to search through a huge (approx. 20 pages) menu.<br><br>We ordered the (pork?) potsticker dumplings; those were pretty good.  I ordered their &#39;Factory Burger&#39; for my main meal, and quite frankly, I was disappointed with what I got.  The bread was hard and tough to bite through (unlike the appetizer bread), the onions on the bottom were sort of sad-looking, and while the meat was cooked as ordered, the meal itself didn&#39;t come out very hot (unlike the plate).  In hindsight, I should&#39;ve ordered what my husband had, the &#39;Bacon-Bacon&#39; burger.  That looked a lot more satisfactory, to be honest.<br><br>The portion sizes are pretty big, so if you choose to order dessert afterwards, I suggest you get it to-go.  I ordered the Mango Key Lime cheesecake, which tasted lovely (but I do wish they&#39;d cut back on the coconut a little bit).  However, for what it&#39;s worth, the prices for just about everything on the menu are...too pricey.  An appetizer (some running about $7-$9) here could get you an -entire meal- elsewhere.<br><br>As far as service goes, it was decent.  Nothing particularly outstanding or terrible.<br><br>In short, avoid the &#39;Factory Burger&#39;, it&#39;s a total rip-off.  As a whole, the restaurant is a nice treat...once in a while, when you&#39;ve got the -extra money- to splurge.  It&#39;s on the (much?) more expensive end for casual restaurants.

I have visited this location several times and have never been disappointed.  Great for lunch and, of course, for dinner.  The Miso Salmon is to die for.<br>Interestingly - I have never had their cheesecake... so I defer to others for a review of that.

Finally I can give The Cheesecake Factory a good review.  I think this is the first CF I&#39;ve been to that didn&#39;t make us wait around an hour or more for a table - no matter what time or day of the week, and no matter which location.  Came here on the Sunday evening before MLK Day.  The restaurant was pretty full, so I was expected to get a long wait time.  But to my great surprise, we were seated in less than 2 minutes!  Our server had great timing, didn&#39;t rush us but was plenty attentive.  The presentation of every dish was nice, and the dishes came out quick but good timing.  I liked that they didn&#39;t use much salt the way so many chain restaurants do so that we could control that.  I ordered the Honey-Truffle Chicken, and it was delicious.  Two big chicken breasts with a tasty coating set on a huge mound of mashed potatoes.  The asparagus with the truffle sauce had such a nice sweet taste.  Strawberry fruit smoothie was huge and very refreshing.  My dining partner had the chicken avocado club sandwich with fries, huge portion, and he really liked it.  We were stuffed but wanted to get the strawberry shortcake.  It&#39;s as good as always and again - huge.  Three people could share that dessert.  It was a great experience.  Thank you CF of Overland Park for finally being a location that is mindful of customers&#39; time!

My boyfriend and I came in on a Saturday night and of course the wait was an hour. We didn&#39;t mind waiting because we were sat right at the one hour mark. The bartenders were really great with getting us drinks while we waited! The only thing we were disappointed in was the waiting space. There was honestly no place for us to wait without being in the way of the servers without us having to go outside in the cold. But, I do understand that is a corporate issue at most Cheesecake Factory&#39;s, not this location specifically. With that being said, the food was delicious and we left feeling full!

We made a vist over a week ago on a Thursday evening waited 45 min for a table, my wife orderd a dinner with tuna the waitress came back said out of tuna so my wife ordered salmon the witress turned around and said also out of salmon, we walked out after that as no excuse for having to wait 45 min for  seating to be  told out of fish, waitress offered to get a manger we said no thanks however the waitress was very apologetic and  not her fault , I wrote a complaint to there corporate office on there web site around a week ago with contact info no response.

Food is just ok. I haven&#39;t been too impressed by it.<br>Cuban bites on the small plate menu tastes like cheeseburger rollups.  <br>Cheesecake is delicious!  (but hella pricey -- 8 bucks for a slice)<br>My personal fave is the Lemon Raspberry.  Not too sweet and the layer of real cake combined with the cheesecake makes it fluffy and dense.  Yeah... I don&#39;t understand that either.  It&#39;s good though.  Promise.<br>I called in my order and they asked me if I needed it delivered to my car.  I figure after consuming about 8 more pieces of cake I will be requiring this service.

We have ate here several times and have always received great service.  Hubs always has the fish and chips.  I try something different every time.  There must be 200 items on the menu!  Oh course cheese cake is always purchased.  This time I tried the mango-lime cheesecake....oh my!  I believe that will be what I order EVERY time!!!<br>Try and dine around 4pm, no waiting!!

Came here for lunch during our most recent visit to the area and were impressed at how fast we were seated, as well as with how often our server came by to check on us. While we initially both ordered burgers, I decided to throw a curveball and order the Fettuccine Alfredo, and the server never missed a beat.<br><br>When we received our order - completely pleased. For a cold, gray and just genuinely dreary day my meal hit the spot and warmed me up. My wife was pleased with her burger, but stopped early because she wanted a slice of cheesecake. She has a better beat on her priorities than I do since... duh, &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34;. I decided to slow down from that point as well.<br><br>The desserts, of course, you can&#39;t lose with. She had a Chocolate Tuxedo Cream Cheesecake while I had the Chocolate Mousse Cheesecake. <br><br>Not the cheapest lunch ever, but you actually get great portion sizes for the dollar. We always seek these places out while on the road, as we don&#39;t have one in Wichita, but yeah. Still coming off the high from the cheesecake almost a week later.

Maybe I don&#39;t understand the big hype about this place?<br><br>I was taking my mom to dinner, I had been here once, she had never been. The place is always busy. Let&#39;s face it. Always. This place turns over some insane amount of business. We walked in, and were not at all surprised to find ourselves a 10-15 minute wait. No biggie. We were given a little light up thing, and told to wait.<br><br>The wait actually was pretty quick before it light up and began vibrating, telling us it was time to sit. We went back to the host stand, they took our light up thing, and then.... We waited. They lost our table (?) - they forgot who we were (?) - we waited almost 10 more minutes, before they finally asked &#34;What was the name? It&#39;ll be a 10-15 minute wait.&#34; Uh... yea, no. I informed them we had waited, and already turned in our light up thing that should have gotten us a coveted seat at the wonderous Factory a la Cheesecake. They did find a table for us. A table, towards a corner of the restaurant, that sat exactly 2 people, and the table left little room for 2 waters, let alone food or bread. But, it was a table.<br><br>The waitress took about 10 minutes to come to us with waters, another 10 to bring the drinks we ordered.. and the food. Sigh. Mom ordered an omlette - eggs people. 10 minute cook time, max.. I ordered a salad - the tuna tataki salad - RAW... and still, our food took 47 minutes to arrive to our table.
